snippet: The diplomatic drain comes amid uncertainty over what conditions will be like in the country after the Western military withdrawal, scheduled to be completed in 2014.
abstract: Many Afghan envoys, uncertain over what conditions will be like in their home country after the Western military withdrawal, decline to return when their tours of duty end; most ambassadors have dual citizenship, but lower-level diplomatic staff members often must resort to going underground or applying for asylum, as many emigrants from Afghanistan already do.
lead_paragraph: The diplomatic drain comes amid uncertainty over what conditions will be like in the country after the Western military withdrawal, scheduled to be completed in 2014.

headline.main: As Uncertainty Reigns Back Home, Many Afghan Envoys Decline to Return
headline.print_headline: As Uncertainty Reigns Back Home, Many Afghan Envoys Decline to Return
